current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text:
To amend title XVIII of the Social Security Act to modify payment under the Medicare program for
			 outpatient department procedures that utilize drugs as supplies, and for
			 other purposes.

cosponsor.#tail: ) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Ensuring Equal Access to Treatments Act of 2014
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Ensuring Equal Access to Treatments Act of 2014

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

quote.#tail: and all that follows and inserting the following:

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Section 1833(t)(2)(G) of the Social Security Act

header.#text:
Payment under the Medicare program for outpatient department procedures that utilize drugs as
			 supplies

text.#text:
create additional groups of covered OPD services that classify separately those procedures that
			 utilize contrast agents from those that do not;

continuation-text.#text: from those that do not; and

text.#text:
create and implement, for services furnished after the date of the enactment of this
			 clause and in a budget neutral manner, additional groups of covered OPD
			 services that classify separately those procedures that utilize a drug
			 (other than contrast agents and diagnostic radiopharmaceuticals) that
			 both—
has a cost above the drug packaging threshold; and
functions as a supply when used in a diagnostic test or procedure;

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}title.#text: 113 S2980 IS: Ensuring Equal Access to Treatments Act of 2014

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}rights.#text: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
